intro: Zapoteca costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican zapoteca, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many economically important plants such as coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
